text: We must make sure that the checks from the first stimulus package get to people as quickly as possible. #PaycheckProtectionPlan is NOT a traditional SBA program

2 steps:

1. #SmallBusiness finds participating lender to verify their payroll
2. They receive 250% of monthly payroll & it doesn’t have to be paid back if used to pay workers or business rent

 https://apnews.com/82e85f697b92a02f89795d36652f3c17

Throughout history, authoritarian leaders have used moments of crisis to seize unchecked power. Hungary’s Orban is the latest example. Now more than ever we must stand up for democracy and rule of law. https://www.euronews.com/2020/03/30/blank-cheque-hungary-expected-to-pass-controversial-covid-19-law

Comprehensive demographic data on who is being tested & treated for coronavirus doesn’t exist. @RepPressley & I aren't going to let up until we see @HHSgov collect solid data & make real progress to ensure communities of color have equal access to free testing & treatment.

Every day public health professionals on the frontlines of #COVID19 put their own health on the line to care for others. On #NationalDoctorsDay we should celebrate these heroes not just with our words but with our actions—practice social distancing, stay home & stay healthy.

Workers at @Amazon & @Instacart are on the frontlines of this pandemic to keep people fed & at home. These are employees who need safe workplaces, safety equipment, paid sick leave, overtime & hazard pay for this critical work. I’m with them all the way. https://www.npr.org/2020/03/30/823767492/amazon-instacart-grocery-delivery-workers-strike-for-coronavirus-protection-and-

MA is in a race against time for medical supplies while hundreds of our hospital workers already have COVID-19. NY has put up trailers as morgues. Mnuchin has a choice: he can help save lives on the frontlines of this pandemic, or he can bail out a bunch of corporate executives.

.@Yamiche, thank you for speaking truth to power and asking the questions Americans deserve answers to. Keep pressing on. https://twitter.com/yamiche/status/1244413018026491905 QT @Yamiche President Trump today at the White House said to me: “Be nice. Don't be threatening.”

I’m not the first human being, woman, black person or journalist to be told that while doing a job. 

My take: Be steady. Stay focused.  Remember your purpose. And, always press forward.

The FDA's policies that inhibit members of the LGBTQ community from giving blood are not only unscientific, they're discriminatory. 

Now as our nation faces a blood shortage, there couldn't be a better time to lift these restrictions once and for all.
https://www.nbcnews.com/feature/nbc-out/senators-urge-overhaul-gay-donor-restrictions-amid-blood-shortage-n1170741

The key goal of distancing is buying time. For more tests. For more ventilators. To open up more beds in hospitals. To allow researchers to make progress on anti-virals. 

I know its a big hassle & comes at a high economic price. 

But the alternative outcome is far worse.

Maine got 5%.

Colorado only got enough for 1 day, per a GOP congressman.

But "Florida has been an exception in its dealings with the stockpile." It got everything it asked for within 3 days.

There is something very, very wrong when we spend twice as much per capita on health care as other major countries, yet tens of millions are uninsured and we have worse health outcomes.

The profit-driven health care system has got to change.

We need Medicare for All.

The CARES Act delivers $377B in emergency relief directly to small businesses. $350B of that is for guaranteed loans. And if you’re a small business using these loans to keep your employees on the payroll or pay your rent or utilities, the loan will be forgiven. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1244654715415166976/img/VUFKloaR4JmxGX6j.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1244654715415166976/vid/480x270/pFJchjf_gSjQd8m8.mp4?tag=13

First Instacart, then Amazon, now Whole Foods: workers are withholding their labor& demanding dignity.

When people work an hourly job, it’s suggested in many ways that you‘re unimportant or expendable.

Except you aren’t. Everyone deserves safe work, paid leave, & a living wage. https://twitter.com/laurenkgurley/status/1244665693712203780 QT @LaurenKGurley The strike wave is in full swing! Whole Foods workers across the country are staging a mass "sick out" tomorrow — following strikes today at Instacart and an Amazon warehouse in NYC. Yes: if you hire a domestic worker and have the means, PLEASE continue to pay them through this crisis.

So many families rely on domestic work to survive. My mom cleaned houses to put me through college as my dad went through cancer treatment.

Your $ keeps a family fed &housed. https://twitter.com/clintsmithiii/status/1244628315425603586 QT @ClintSmithIII This point has been made but it's worth repeating: if you have someone who usually cleans your house, if you have someone who usually mows your lawn, if you have someone who watches your children you should, if you have the means, continue to pay that person. Especially now.

Proof that tapping the incredible might of our free enterprise system will help save lives. We must continue to do everything possible to make sure doctors don’t have to make life and death decisions based on a shortage of ventilators. https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-ford-motor/ford-ge-to-produce-50000-ventilators-in-100-days-idUSKBN21H39F

Heartbroken to share that #LorenaBorjas, a prolific trans organizer & Queens activist, passed away from COVID-19.

Lorena championed mutual aid in the LGBT+ community, and her Community Fund was saving lives of queer people & immigrants impacted by COVID:
https://www.gofundme.com/f/transgender-people-emergency-fund-101 https://twitter.com/bianeydlao/status/1244610606294073345 QT @BianeyDlaO Is very sad to wake up this morning and know that one of the TRANS rights activists in NYC has lost the battle against #Coronavirus.
